revised_title: Physico-Chemical Study of Induced Morphological Changes in Bacterium Lactis Aerogenes
tldr: The author conducted a physico-chemical study on induced changes in the morphology of Bacterium lactis aerogenes. They discovered that the size distribution of cells in cultures giving snake-forms follows an exponential law, which suggests that cell division is delayed due to a less probable conjunction of events inside the cell. The study also found that the balance and adaptive variation of enzyme processes in bacteria play a crucial role in determining cell morphology.
